name: UITableViewDelegate
desc: Methods for managing selections, configuring section headers and footers, deleting and reordering cells, and performing other actions in a table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willDisplay: UITableViewCell, forRowAt: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate the table view is about to draw a cell for a particular row.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, indentationLevelForRowAt: IndexPath) -> Int
items.desc: Asks the delegate to return the level of indentation for a row in a given section.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, shouldSpringLoadRowAt: IndexPath, with: UISpringLoadedInteractionContext) -> Bool
items.desc: Called to let you fine tune the spring-loading behavior of the rows in a table.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willSelectRowAt: IndexPath) -> IndexPath?
items.desc: Tells the delegate a row is about to be selected.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didSelectRowAt: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate a row is selected.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willDeselectRowAt: IndexPath) -> IndexPath?
items.desc: Tells the delegate that a specified row is about to be deselected.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didDeselectRowAt: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the specified row is now deselected.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, shouldBeginMultipleSelectionInteractionAt: IndexPath) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate whether the user can use a two-finger pan gesture to select multiple items in a table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didBeginMultipleSelectionInteractionAt: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate when the user starts using a two-finger pan gesture to select multiple rows in a table view.

items.name: func tableViewDidEndMultipleSelectionInteraction(UITableView)
items.desc: Tells the delegate when the user stops using a two-finger pan gesture to select multiple rows in a table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, viewForHeaderInSection: Int) -> UIView?
items.desc: Asks the delegate for a view to display in the header of the specified section of the table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, viewForFooterInSection: Int) -> UIView?
items.desc: Asks the delegate for a view to display in the footer of the specified section of the table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willDisplayHeaderView: UIView, forSection: Int)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the table is about to display the header view for the specified section.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willDisplayFooterView: UIView, forSection: Int)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the table is about to display the footer view for the specified section.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, heightForRowAt: IndexPath) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Asks the delegate for the height to use for a row in a specified location.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, heightForHeaderInSection: Int) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Asks the delegate for the height to use for the header of a particular section.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, heightForFooterInSection: Int) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Asks the delegate for the height to use for the footer of a particular section.

items.name: class let automaticDimension: CGFloat
items.desc: A constant representing the default value for a given dimension.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, estimatedHeightForRowAt: IndexPath) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Asks the delegate for the estimated height of a row in a specified location.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, estimatedHeightForHeaderInSection: Int) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Asks the delegate for the estimated height of the header of a particular section.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, estimatedHeightForFooterInSection: Int) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Asks the delegate for the estimated height of the footer of a particular section.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, accessoryButtonTappedForRowWith: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the user tapped the detail button for the specified row.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, contextMenuConfigurationForRowAt: IndexPath, point: CGPoint) -> UIContextMenuConfiguration?
items.desc: Returns a context menu configuration for the row at a point.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, previewForDismissingContextMenuWithConfiguration: UIContextMenuConfiguration) -> UITargetedPreview?
items.desc: Returns the destination view when dismissing a context menu.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, previewForHighlightingContextMenuWithConfiguration: UIContextMenuConfiguration) -> UITargetedPreview?
items.desc: Returns a view to override the default preview the table view created.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willDisplayContextMenu: UIContextMenuConfiguration, animator: UIContextMenuInteractionAnimating?)
items.desc: Informs the delegate when a context menu will appear.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willEndContextMenuInteraction: UIContextMenuConfiguration, animator: UIContextMenuInteractionAnimating?)
items.desc: Informs the delegate when a context menu will disappear.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willPerformPreviewActionForMenuWith: UIContextMenuConfiguration, animator: UIContextMenuInteractionCommitAnimating)
items.desc: Informs the delegate when a user triggers a commit by tapping the preview.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, leadingSwipeActionsConfigurationForRowAt: IndexPath) -> UISwipeActionsConfiguration?
items.desc: Returns the swipe actions to display on the leading edge of the row.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, trailingSwipeActionsConfigurationForRowAt: IndexPath) -> UISwipeActionsConfiguration?
items.desc: Returns the swipe actions to display on the trailing edge of the row.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, shouldHighlightRowAt: IndexPath) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if the specified row should be highlighted.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didHighlightRowAt: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the specified row was highlighted.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didUnhighlightRowAt: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the highlight was removed from the row at the specified index path.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, willBeginEditingRowAt: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the table view is about to go into editing mode.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didEndEditingRowAt: IndexPath?)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the table view has left editing mode.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, editingStyleForRowAt: IndexPath) -> UITableViewCell.EditingStyle
items.desc: Asks the delegate for the editing style of a row at a particular location in a table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, titleForDeleteConfirmationButtonForRowAt: IndexPath) -> String?
items.desc: Changes the default title of the delete-confirmation button.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, shouldIndentWhileEditingRowAt: IndexPath) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate whether the background of the specified row should be indented while the table view is in editing mode.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, targetIndexPathForMoveFromRowAt: IndexPath, toProposedIndexPath: IndexPath) -> IndexPath
items.desc: Asks the delegate to return a new index path to retarget a proposed move of a row.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didEndDisplaying: UITableViewCell, forRowAt: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the specified cell was removed from the table.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didEndDisplayingHeaderView: UIView, forSection: Int)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the specified header view was removed from the table.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didEndDisplayingFooterView: UIView, forSection: Int)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the specified footer view was removed from the table.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, canFocusRowAt: IndexPath) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate whether the cell at the specified index path is itself focusable.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, shouldUpdateFocusIn: UITableViewFocusUpdateContext) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate whether the focus update specified by the context is allowed to occur.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, didUpdateFocusIn: UITableViewFocusUpdateContext, with: UIFocusAnimationCoordinator)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that a focus update specified by the context has just occurred.

items.name: func indexPathForPreferredFocusedView(in: UITableView) -> IndexPath?
items.desc: Asks the delegate for the table viewâ€™s index path for the preferred focused view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, selectionFollowsFocusForRowAt: IndexPath) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate whether to relate selection and focus behavior for the row at the corresponding index path.
